meanings.definition: A fine-grained, translucent form of gypsum, typically white or delicately tinted and used for carving.
meanings.sent1: The sculptor used alabaster to create a beautiful statue.
meanings.sent2: The alabaster figurine glowed softly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the alabaster sculpture, creating a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her skin was as smooth as alabaster, reflecting the purity of her soul.
meanings.sent5: The alabaster stone seemed to hold a piece of the sky within its delicate form.

meanings.definition: A pale, soft, fine-grained variety of gypsum.
meanings.sent1: The ancient vase was made of delicate alabaster.
meanings.sent2: She admired the alabaster walls of the old castle.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly used alabaster instead of flour in the recipe.
meanings.sent4: The moon cast a soft alabaster glow over the sleeping town.
meanings.sent5: The alabaster rock felt cool and smooth to the touch.
